Key Match Events: Rookie Jhonkensy Noel singled home Josh Naylor with the go-ahead run in the seventh inning
Bo Naylor homered off starter Michael Wacha
Andrés Giménez tacked on a sacrifice fly in the eighth
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland manager Stephen Vogt said, "We haven’t looked like ourselves for a while, but that inning, that was us. It was such a great response by our guys. Erceg has been very good, but Will came up with a big swing and Big Christmas (Noel) again comes through."
Kansas City first baseman Vinnie Pasquantino said, "I think we have their respect and they have ours. It’s going to be a fun month."
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kansas City had its seven-game road winning streak snapped
Others: Eli Morgan (2-0) pitched 1 1/3 scoreless innings for the victory
Emmanuel Clase earned his AL-best 39th save — with his career-high 26th straight conversion — and matched Cody Allen’s franchise record with 149
Bobby Witt Jr., Pasquantino and Michael Massey hit solo homers off Guardians ace Tanner Bibee
Witt went 2 for 5 and continues to lead baseball with a.346 batting average, 185 hits and 114 runs
Wacha was denied his 100th career win, pitching six-plus innings and allowing five runs
